title: Citi Foundation Makes $1 Million Commitment to Automate CARS' Performance Data Collection System for CDFIs
summary: New York - The Citi Foundation is making a $1 million grant to the CDFI Assessment and Ratings System Inc. (CARS™) to develop the first automated financial performance data collection system for community development financial institutions (CDFIs). This innovative new system will aggregate quarterly performance data on CARS-rated CDFIs to address investor demand.
tag-1: Citi Foundation Makes $1 Million Commitment to Automate CARS' Performance Data Collection System for CDFIs
tag-3: New York – The Citi Foundation is making a $1 million grant to the CDFI Assessment and Ratings System Inc. (CARS™) to develop the first automated financial performance data collection system for community development financial institutions (CDFIs). This innovative new system will aggregate quarterly performance data on CARS-rated CDFIs to address investor demand.
tag-4: "The Citi Foundation has supported CDFIs for more than two decades because we believe they serve a critical role in making capital and economic opportunity available in places that may not have access to more traditional financing sources," said Pam Flaherty, President & CEO of the Citi Foundation. "Our goal with this commitment is to standardize and streamline the flow of CDFI performance data so that investors can make more informed investment decisions and direct significantly more capital to underserved individuals and businesses."
tag-5: The CARS system will automate the collection of performance data and serve as a central information repository similar to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation's call report system for banks. The system will also enable CARS™-rated CDFIs to report their data with minimal effort, ensuring more frequent and timelier reporting.
tag-6: Currently, the absence of standardized financial reporting combined with the complex business models of CDFI loan funds create an obstacle for impact-motivated investors who are interested in the sector but unable to analyze the performance of specific institutions against industry trends. CARS' new Citi Foundation-funded platform will remove this information barrier by providing timely, standardized data that will elevate the credibility of the industry among a broader universe of investors.
tag-7: "We appreciate the Citi Foundation's confidence in CARS and the opportunity to partner with them on this important effort," said Paige Chapel, President & CEO of CARS. "CARS strives to help investors gain comfort and familiarity with the risks and rewards of investing in CDFI loan funds. These investors consistently tell us they need access to timely, standardized data to better understand—and invest in—the industry. We believe access to quarterly performance data will spur investor analysis of and investment in CDFIs, leading to an increase in the flow of capital to low-income communities."
tag-8: Once the system is operational, CARS will provide access to the data via an interactive, web-based analytic tool. Participating CDFIs will receive complimentary access to this tool, allowing for real-time peer comparisons that will offer valuable insight about ways to strengthen their company.
tag-9: Citi's commitment will fund development of the data collection system, including assembling an advisory board of CDFI financial managers to advise on system design, developing the collection platform, prototyping and beta testing.

tag-13: CARS The CDFI Assessment and Ratings System, Inc. (CARS) was established in 2004 as a project of Opportunity Finance Network. Launched in 2012 as an independent corporation, it is the only information service offering insightful, comprehensive CDFI industry intelligence to socially-motivated investors and CDFIs committed to continuous improvement and expanded social impact. CARS services include: CDFI assessment reports and ratings; customized analytic services and financial trend analyses; and training for investors on underwriting. http://www.carsratingsystem.net
tag-14: CDFIs CDFIs are private financial institutions dedicated to delivering responsible, affordable capital that helps low-income, low-wealth, and other disadvantaged people and communities join the economic mainstream. CARS rates the impact performance and financial strength and performance of CDFI loan funds, bringing transparency and standardization to the CDFI sector.
